intro: Randia lemairei, commonly known as the Lemaire's randia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. It typically grows as an herbaceous perennial or shrub, often found in moist, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both horticulture and ecological studies.
